When I first saw Reddit singing songs of praise for Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed I was skeptical at best. After 21 hours of play time I can say the praise is well deserved.

The carts are varied and customisable (leveling up the carts will eventually give you 7 stats mods variants to choose from). Boosting/power sliding is tight and responsive and tracks range from standard cart racing to a mixture land, sea and air which you switch between on the fly.

With a roster of 29 characters, the option of 4 player local split screen and full controller support Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed really does hold its own in the cart racing genre.

reviewText: I guess i should start with being honest, i am bias towards racing games as they made up a great portion of my childhood gaming experience, having grown up with games like: Crash Team Racing, Gran Turismo, Mario Kart, Ridge Racer, Toy Story Racing, and so on; although often the crucible of frustration and anger but still very dear to me. After playing 'Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed' i can wholeheartedly say without a doubt that this racing games takes the cake as the most enjoyable for me. Naturally this is my own, personal opinion and i'm aware that others will disagree, but i think that this particular racing game is just brilliant; great characters, courses, stunts, boosts, challenges, soundtrack, online playability, you name it and it's here.\n\nAny racing lover needs to try this game, you won't be disappointed.

A wonderful game that pays tribute to everything Sega, Sonic and All-Stars Racing Transformed is something that will crush the competition for years to come.

The Good:

Level Design and Diversity: S&ART's levels come in many different shapes and sizes, and all of them provide a rich, detailed and fun experience for the players. From challenging levels make Rainbow Road look easy to wonderfuly crafted thematic levels such as  Dream Valley, S&ART has a level for every skill level.
Character Diversity: Every vehicle and level in S&ART has it's unique style and feel and style. From General Winter's Tank to Shogun's wooden... Chariot, The level of character diversity in S&ART easily surpasses the majority of arcade racing games on the market.

The Notable:

The Boats and Planes: The addition of boats and planes has opened up many unique opportunies for fun and often whacky levels. However, this is no Skydrift or Hydro Thunder. The boats often feel slow and clunky, and the feeling of being in water is only kept there by the predictable wave effects. The planes are meant to be the fastest and most agile of the vehicles, and yet they feel very bloated and dance through the sky instead of cutting through the air. Drifting is also a very gimicked function on these two modes, and serves as a tie-in feature to keep the feel of the game consistent.
Modes that aren't Racing: From 'Capture the Chao' to 'Battle Arena', secondary modes serve as mostly a distraction (albeit an intresting and somewhat fun one) from the core of the game. The fun that one may have is generally very inconsistent as these modes generally rely on utilising one feature of the game over and over again.


The Bad:
Poorly designed PC Menus: Graphical customisation cannot be done in game, it must be instead configured through an external menu. The placement of the menu items in game are also have a 'console port' feel, with clunky selection menus and awkwardly placed buttons.

Has pretty much everything you want out of a kart racer:  balanced power-ups, great level design, large cast of characters, plenty of challenge, smooth online play, local multiplayer, and some fantastic visuals.  If you can look past the fact that you might not recognise some of the racers then you have no reason not to give this game a try.  Seriously, it's easily one of the best kart racing games ever made... it's up there with CTR, Diddy Kong Racing, and whichever Mario Kart you prefer.

I know it can be easy to write this game off.  After all, how many Mario Kart clones did we see after the N64 version blew up?  But instead of merely copying another franchise and putting a Sega skin over everything, you'll quickly notice that the developers genuinely tried to take full advantage of every licence they got.  Putting as much detail as possible into each racer's kart and respective tracks.  The tracks are really well designed; they never get too long or feel too short, they contain plenty of variety thanks to the ability to jump between car/plane/boat, and often change dramatically as the race progresses.  The gameplay itself is a sweet mix of CTR and Diddy Kong Racing, but with their own unique take on the two.

The game's one weak point (outside of maybe the initial learning curve) is some of the character selection.  While they do try to include plenty of female characters, a few of their choices are kinda lame side characters, but it's a minor complaint and the roster is otherwise very creative and varied.  Plus the PC version has 31 (!) total characters, which is great.

If this is a style of game you enjoy or have ever enjoyed previously, I highly recommend picking this up.  If you can manage to play it with friends then you are in for some competitive gaming bliss.

[h] Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed: Surprisingly Good [/h]

Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed (hereafter referred to as Sonic Racing), is a very weel designed kart racing game. It takes aspects from games like Mario Kart and improves on them, and is arguably better than Mario Kart. Althoug it's not a perfect port, it is still a nice game.

Pros:
-One of few kart racers for PC, with splitscreen
-Racing is smooth and well-designed
-A whole bunch of characters from all over the place
-Plays moderatly well with a keyboard
-Plays great with controller

Cons:
-Some issues with the port (lag during loadtimes, took some tweaking to get it working on a tv)
-Connecting additional controllers took a bit of work

All in all, I think Sonic Racing is a fun party game to throw on if you have some controllers and some friends.

Where Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing was a fun, casual Mario Kart knock off, this latest installment to Sega racing has been transformed (ho ho) into a fairly unique and challenging experience.  Well, as unique as Sega gets these days.  Fun racings.

Scale: 1=despised 2=negative 3=could go either way 4=acceptable 5=loved
Game design: 4/5  Controls and graphics have been tightened up a lot since the last game, and I didn't think anything was wrong with them then.  I'm not paying attention to the music nearly as much, but that isn't a bad thing.
Tone: 4/5  Not nearly as light hearted as the last game, but that suits the changes perfectly.
Personal skew: 3/5  Meh.  Sega promotes both aspiration and fear in my heart.

A lot of people think this game is just a copy of Mario Kart 7, due to the flying and boat transformations. However, alot of people don't know that Sega had the Idea first. I bought the original game on my DS. Not very good graphics or gameplay. Then I saw this game on sale, and I couldn't stop myself from buying it, as well as a little bit of DLC. This game is amazing. 10/10. The graphics have improved, though that may just be my opinion because of the DS' graphics. The gameplay is better than Mario Kart. In Mario Kart 7, during the flying sections, you don't feel much control. Sonic & All-Stars Racing: Transformed fixes that. At first I didn't realize I had much power over flying, so I ended up in last place. I even had the game turn on Y-axis. Also the game's cast of characters are great. Wreck It Ralph, Yogscast, Pyro, Heavy, and Spy all make appearances. Well, Pyro, Heavy, and Spy make up one team called Team Fortess, so, does that still count? I'm saying yes. Anyways, if this game wasn't on sale I probably wouldn't even try it. But, I ended up loving it. Man, I love this game.\n

The frankly bizarre roster is likely to inspire a love or hate response, featuring distinctly non-iconic characters like Wreck-It Ralph, Football Manager and real-life driver Danica Patrick, but past that is a genuinely fantastic kart racer with a lot of care put into its design.

I was intensely skeptical at first, but Sumo Digital have put together a genuine competitor to Mario Kart, and a distinctly less luck-based one at that. The branching track design and stackable" boost system both contribute to making the game easy to pick up while also ensuring that victory in higher-level matches is very much a matter of skill.

The game comes with a comprehensive host of local and online multiplayer options as well as a fairly substantial singleplayer campaign. Highly recommended."

It had been a long time since I last played a good old racing kart game, and suddenly this game appeared before my eyes on Steam. By looking at some videos of the gameplay and reading some of the positive reviews I decided to give it a shot, and boy did I become a fan real quick! I have always liked kart games like these for their beautiful colors, goofy characters and creative weapons and this game nails those spots right on!\nWith beloved characters from the SEGA universe and some newcomers, this game offers a real nice variation of vehicles along with awesome and unique All-Star moves to go along with which lets you choose your way to devastate the track when you're having a bad day and watch you fly right past the competition in an awesome spectacle, may it be by the usage of rockets, soundwaves or bananas. The creative weapons are both amusing and rediculous and makes the races go completely out of control which is one of the charms of kart games like these. You can also find the usual powerups which lets you boost up to higher speeds or block incoming attacks, but with all the crazy weapons and powerups aside, this game can really offer you a test of racing skill to see if you got what it takes to go even faster by using risky air-stunts and powerful drift-boosts which, altough makes the game a little more difficult, also makes the game more thrilling and exciting and overall more fun. The race tracks are, what you would expect, tracks based on several of the SEGA character's original titles which definitely is a must for party games like these, and putting the Transformed" in this game's title is the fact that in most of the stages there is a transition to race by both boat and plane during the race which puts more variety and challenge into the game.\nSo if you're a fan of racing games with elements of driving by car
date: boat and plane as well as neat combos you can pull off
recommended: or even if you're just a fan of Sonic and his friends I truly recommend and tell you that this game is for you!"

It's Sega's version of Mario Kart.  Or maybe Diddy Kong Racing since you transform on the fly mid-race on a regular basis.  You'll see levels derived from such Sega classics as Nights, Golden Axe, After Burner, House of the Dead, Billy Hatcher, Super Monkey Ball, Samba de Amigo, Skies of Arcadia, Jet Grind Radio, and much more.  And you get to play as characters from all of those games and more.\n\nThis is a huge love letter from Sega wrapped in race tracks and you owe it to yourself to pick this up if you haven't already.

Easily the best kart racer of this generation, and probably the best one ever released on PC. It's not a dramatic departure from the formula invented by Mario Kart, but Sonic Transformed tweaks and improves upon that formula in a lot of ways that make it even better than Nintendo's more recent offerings. Weapons are a lot more fair and can be dodged with quick and careful driving. The single-player mode offers up a huge amount of missions with a lot of variety. The graphics are gorgeous. The trick system for earning boosts encourages learning the tracks. The three different vehicle modes all handle very differently. There's a lot of depth here if you want to dive into the time trials.

And if you're into Sega, this has a ridiculous amount of fanservice. From Segata Sanshiro to Burning Rangers to Panzer Dragoon, this is the ultimate tribute to Sega's history.

About the only major flaw is the inability to turn off weapons in online or grand prix play. Some of the single-player missions are weaponless races, and it's a real shame that you can't play like that with friends or in a racing series. But it's telling that I consider that a flaw - that the core racing in a kart racer is so good that I want to enjoy it without the accoutrements normally layered on top of games in the genre.

Buy it, buy it now.

It had been a long time since I last played a good old racing kart game, and suddenly this game appeared before my eyes on Steam. By looking at some videos of the gameplay and reading some of the positive reviews I decided to give it a shot, and boy did I become a fan real quick! I have always liked kart games like these for their beautiful colors, goofy characters and creative weapons and this game nails those spots right on!\nWith beloved characters from the SEGA universe and some newcomers, this game offers a real nice variation of vehicles along with awesome and unique All-Star moves to go along with which lets you choose your way to devastate the track when you're having a bad day and watch you fly right past the competition in an awesome spectacle, may it be by the usage of rockets, soundwaves or bananas. The creative weapons are both amusing and rediculous and makes the races go completely out of control which is one of the charms of kart games like these. You can also find the usual powerups which lets you boost up to higher speeds or block incoming attacks, but with all the crazy weapons and powerups aside, this game can really offer you a test of racing skill to see if you got what it takes to go even faster by using risky air-stunts and powerful drift-boosts which, altough makes the game a little more difficult, also makes the game more thrilling and exciting and overall more fun. The race tracks are, what you would expect, tracks based on several of the SEGA character's original titles which definitely is a must for party games like these, and putting the Transformed" in this game's title is the fact that in most of the stages there is a transition to race by both boat and plane during the race which puts more variety and challenge into the game.\nSo if you're a fan of racing games with elements of driving by car
date: boat and plane as well as neat combos you can pull off
recommended: or even if you're just a fan of Sonic and his friends I truly recommend and tell you that this game is for you!"

To say this game is a fun arcade kart racer would be the understatement of this gaming generation. Everything in this game is an absolute delight from the music and stages to the myraid of characters represented, my personal favorite being Vyse. The game isn't for the faint of heart however as one progresses to higher difficulties, the challenges, all of which intuitively teach you to become a better racer, become harder than you would expect of any kart racer and even many contemporary games in this generally casualized generation. To learn also that this game was a budget shows that SUMO is able to strech every penny they were given, making this an absolutely pleasant experience. The only complaint I can make about this game is the cast which certainly by any range wouldn't be considered a cast of All-stars with YogsCast, Football Manager, and Total War taking priority over Shenmune, or Vectorman. These complaints are rather minimal however with the news of additional DLC possibly coming that might entail such characters being added.

Has pretty much everything you want out of a kart racer:  balanced power-ups, great level design, large cast of characters, plenty of challenge, smooth online play, local multiplayer, and some fantastic visuals.  If you can look past the fact that you might not recognise some of the racers then you have no reason not to give this game a try.  Seriously, it's easily one of the best kart racing games ever made... it's up there with CTR, Diddy Kong Racing, and whichever Mario Kart you prefer.

I know it can be easy to write this game off.  After all, how many Mario Kart clones did we see after the N64 version blew up?  But instead of merely copying another franchise and putting a Sega skin over everything, you'll quickly notice that the developers genuinely tried to take full advantage of every licence they got.  Putting as much detail as possible into each racer's kart and respective tracks.  The tracks are really well designed; they never get too long or feel too short, they contain plenty of variety thanks to the ability to jump between car/plane/boat, and often change dramatically as the race progresses.  The gameplay itself is a sweet mix of CTR and Diddy Kong Racing, but with their own unique take on the two.

The game's one weak point (outside of maybe the initial learning curve) is some of the character selection.  While they do try to include plenty of female characters, a few of their choices are kinda lame side characters, but it's a minor complaint and the roster is otherwise very creative and varied.  Plus the PC version has 31 (!) total characters, which is great.

If this is a style of game you enjoy or have ever enjoyed previously, I highly recommend picking this up.  If you can manage to play it with friends then you are in for some competitive gaming bliss.

Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed completely outclasses its predecessor, Sonic & SEGA All-Stars Racing, in every way. This game is amazing, and playing split-screen or online multiplayer with friends is a lot of fun. The character selection, course design and gameplay are some of the best in the genre, and the soundtrack is an absolutely incredible selection of remixed classic tunes, to which you can credit Richard Jacques, also known for his work on Sonic R, Sonic 3D Blast Saturn and Metropolis Street Racer, among many other things.

And it's not just a straight console port either! In fact, while this game is great on X360, PS3 and Wii U, the PC version is the definitive version, offering improved textures, resolution and is the only version capable of running in 60fps. The PC exclusive characters leave a lot to be desired though, but their presence doesn't retroactively ruin the game. They're just not a deal-maker over the console editions.

If you're sick of Mario Kart, then this is the best Mario Kart killer since Crash Team Racing. It's a game that is truly full of surprises.

Best Multiplayer fun in years and yes its better than Mario Kart 7. Dont be fooled by its cover; its roster and maps arent just  a big sonic orgy. The powerups feel balanced enough so its not too fustrating just Buy It! It reminds you why you loved racing games so much as a kid

reviewText: Really fun game. The racing is fast paced, and exciting. Though I will say if your internet sucks, don't expect to enjoy playing with others. Your connections will keep you at the back of the race.

[h] Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed: Surprisingly Good [/h]

Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed (hereafter referred to as Sonic Racing), is a very weel designed kart racing game. It takes aspects from games like Mario Kart and improves on them, and is arguably better than Mario Kart. Althoug it's not a perfect port, it is still a nice game.

Pros:
-One of few kart racers for PC, with splitscreen
-Racing is smooth and well-designed
-A whole bunch of characters from all over the place
-Plays moderatly well with a keyboard
-Plays great with controller

Cons:
-Some issues with the port (lag during loadtimes, took some tweaking to get it working on a tv)
-Connecting additional controllers took a bit of work

All in all, I think Sonic Racing is a fun party game to throw on if you have some controllers and some friends.

reviewText: Great for children and parents. Lots of fun.

This game was a relief for me. I don’t know why I bought it, I got it on a sale, just because it was cheap. And WOW, what a surprise! It’s fun! Simple as that. The levels are awesome and there are very well designed. My favorite one is the “After Burn Stage”, a Nascar like track with the three different vehicles.

You also have some sort of customization, for hardcore gaming. Full Speed with low handling. You can play this game with the whole family with a Mario party feel, and also do some hardcore time attacking by yourself.

It’s an excellent game that I would recommend buying at its full price with all the DLCs. It’s not an AAA game, but its simplistic fun and awesome gameplay captivated me.

reviewText: When you first look at Sonic all stars racing transformed, it seems like nothing more than a generic kart racer staring sonic.  However if you dig deep enough you'll find a much more complex racing system than in most other racing game.  First of all in addition to the karts you also have access to boats and planes for all characters.  This is where the games design shines as often you'll get multiple options of where to go, one where you take the high road in the skies and the other plodding on the ground or in a boat.  Another nice thing is the items which are only there to spice the game up rather than giving sucky players an unfair advantage.  Even the all star move is balanced in a way that it only really helps if you know how to use it.  The game looks amazing when running at max settings though I've noticed some significant issues with fps even when at minimal settings(Though this may just be my computer.  The game does have it's flaws, characters aren't varried that much especially since all star moves are so much more bland compared to the first game, and the leveling up system is dull and tedious beyond words.  Also I highly reccomend you play this using a controller only as playing with the mouse and keyboard sucks so much its not even worth trying.  But this is the definitive version of All stars transformed as it has additional characters with more promised while the console ports are left in the dust.  And since this game has gone on sale a couple of times since it's release there's little excuse not to pick it up.

Okay, I know what you're thinking: This is a Sega tie-in cartoon racer that is already a year and a half old. But it's worth it, I promise. S&A-SRT is the best Mario Kart clone you never knew you wanted. Cars feel faster, items are more skill dependant to use (and are not scaled based on position), and tracks are vered and exciting. Control takes some getting used to, but is extremely tight once learned. Also, you can play as Football Manager, whats not to love?

I originally had about 56 hours on the Xbox 360 version, so ignore the low hours on Steam:

Pros:

* Wide array of characters (including Wreck-It Ralph and Pyro/Heavy/Spy)

* Runs well on lower end machines (around 40FPS on my Intel HD laptop)

* Flawless controller support (recognized my Xbox One controller right off the bat and no issues with it)

* Every mode is utilized to unlock characters

* More characters than the Xbox 360 version

* Addictive online mode

* No cheaters/hackers online

* Colorful graphics



Cons:

* In my honest opinion, this game is better with a controller. Maybe it's because of my 56 hours on the 360 I'm more used to it, but I feel the default mapped controls are awkward.

* Game can be annoying when searching for an online match, IE you get thrashed in a lobby, so you want to find a new one, game puts you in the exact same lobby you were in before.

* Not a true con in itself, but the tracks are supposed to be based off locations found in that game's universe. However, I only recognized Sonic's, Jet Set Radio's and The House of the Dead's track. The others I had no idea what they were from.

+ "transformed" => car/boat/plane in-race-transformations
+ SP unlocks routes
+ MP unlocks pure fun (Race Modes & Battle Arena)
+ 4 player local splitscreen (also in online multiplayer)
+ max. 10 players multiplayer
+ full X360 controller support

Cons:
- it's Sonic
recommended:
not Mario
- friends for online multiplayer ;)

Get it on Sale for you and your friends and enjoy some Sonic Kart action!"

This is a much more fun version of a game like mario kart.  AND it has split screen which is great if you have extra controllers or keyboards.  really fun!

Bought it at steam winter sale 2015, and it's totally worth it

The main reason I recommend this game is because this game is not luck-based racing game, I also didn't find any weapon nor vehicles which is overpowered. Bots are given same advantages as us that made the game balanced.

You can also find unique race tracks that some of them are changed in every lap, that made tracks in this games are different compared to the other racing games.

It's also enjoyable to play it with keyboard

That's all and hope this review help you

If you like Mario Karts, but don't like the hassle of finding your wii controllers, and LOVE the idea of playing multiplayer with your friends on your very own screen, then this is the game for you.\n\nOne thing I will say, is that it does not like weird monitor resolutions; I have a 27 UltraWide monitor (2560x1080) and you won't even get to the menu
date: so I have to run the game in a more "traditional" resolution
recommended: but that's fine by me.\n\nOn a positive note
hoursPlayed: my biggest problem with MK was that I never really knew where to go
voteText:
but this game not only has MUCH larger indicators of upcoming turns but it also has brightly lit power-ups so you can see them ahead of time and plan your route accordingly.

The inability to skip after-race-stats annoys me (I've been known to break things over inescapable cut-scenes) but I still had a blast with my daughter playing.

So

Absolutely brilliant game to play with your family in split screen and your friends online. 11/10 :D Buying a copy for the Mrs right now!

Well, this is just stupidly fun. Annoyingly I originally played this game using a keyboard (UGHHH) as I didn't have a controller at the time. Only AFTER finishing most of the game did I manage to get hold of an XBOX360 controller. Luckily there is still a large amount to complete which I wouldn't have been able to without the controller

Getting a controller is a must. The drifts are loads of fun and very easy to pull off (my 3 year old can do it) which is great when you don't want to put too much thought into your gameplay.

Love the unlockable characters, to see Team Fortress in there was a pleasent surprise. Graphics wise the game oozes neon and bright colours which adds to the childish fun of it all. Transforming instantly into a boat/car/plane is such a great nod to ones childhood, where you would be playing with a toy car which of course could hop off the couch and onto the floor (sea) where it could take off and fly around the room. Too much fun. Highly recommended.
Played as Team Fortress 2 characters in a child friendly game.\n\n10/10
